creator: bassmang5
title: Raspberry Pi DMX Controller and Pure Data: An Animated Flame Art Installation
materials_required: USB DMX Controller (EntecUSB DMX Pro, OpenDMX USB, or ultraDMX PRO)
description: This project uses a Raspberry Pi, Pure Data, and DMX lighting to create an animated flame art installation. The Raspberry Pi controls DMX lights via a USB DMX device and dimmer pack. The animation is generated using MIDI data, which can be created from audio analysis or with a keyframe MIDI editor.
steps: Choose a compatible Raspberry Pi OS and USB DMX controller, ensuring compatibility between the hardware and software.
Install Pure Data (PD) on the Raspberry Pi.
Configure PD to communicate with the USB DMX Pro controller, possibly using the [comport] object for serial communication.

Create a PD patch to analyze the Lows, Mids and Highs of an audio file and output them to Apple logic as midi. Then export from Logic as individual .midi files. The .midi files were then played back in a different PD patch and the data used to modulate the intensity of the 3 lights.
Alternatively, use a keyframe MIDI editor like Vezér to intuitively create MIDI tracks for controlling the lights. Convert these MIDI tracks into separate .midi files.
Play back the MIDI files in PD and use the data to modulate the intensity of the DMX lights.
Consider adding LED lighting, a wind sensor to react to environmental changes, or an interactive component that allows participants to fuel the installation.
